urls.title: Flood alert remains as more rain forecast
urls.description: A flood alert remains in place on the Eastern Yar.

tweets.text: #travelalert The @EnvAgencySE #floodalert is still in force this afternoon and flooding's been impacting @SouthernVectis and @SW_Help's replacement buses #isleofwight #iwnews #iow Latest: https://t.co/VtY4whevDO https://t.co/ecr1mTlYrW
Our #Swale field team closed the #Queenborough barrier at the weekend (2018 photo) #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/T3NlCcvIrT

Please don’t drive through flood water  
1. Just 30cm can float an average family-sized car 
2. It's the #1 cause of death during flooding 
3. Over ¾ of cars rescued from floods have to be written off 
4. Just 1 egg-cup of water sucked into your engine will wreck it 
Convinced? https://t.co/G9MqMVgSaC

urls.description: Information on this page has been provided by the Environment Agency and was correct at the time of upload. The Flood Hub is not responsible for any information held on this page. For any enquiries, see the Contact section of the

tweets.text:
For the next two weeks, #teamEA & contractors @VolkerStevinUK will be undertaking further ground investigation works in and around #Kendal ahead of works starting on the £76mil Flood Risk Management Scheme

For information on the scheme, visit @TheFloodHub https://t.co/F4fe5jNVEN https://t.co/sTB6nT0vN0
@MarkBowersEA Congratulations, do you know if anyone will be covering the Shrewsbury area.

urls.title: Thames Water discharging raw sewage into Buckinghamshire river
urls.description: River Chess Association say untreated sewage is causing untold harm to infant trout and other habitats

tweets.text:
Another week and yet another example of what a failed and discredited organisation the @EnvAgency has become.

https://t.co/4DP5nBsia5

Our officers are supporting the Environment Agency with their work on the installation of the temporary flood defence barrier at Walton Lane. @EnvAgencySE and @MariaHerlihyEA https://t.co/YdNXo1B1yy #SurreyPrepared #floodaware https://t.co/UkcBOtqABR

Have a Great & Safe Week Everyone 👍❤️👍
@ViridorUK @RothesFire @VeoliaUK @WardRecycling @BritSafe @StaffsFire @NHSuk @UltraSafeSup_ @RenewableUK @Biffa @BritishGas @FTSOnline @EnvAgencyMids @SPRenewables @safe_contractor @H_S_E @BritSafe @bsafefire 🙂 https://t.co/eU9niNtuCC

tweets.text:
CEO of the @EnvAgency has been forced to confess he has no idea what he is talking about.

Who knew? https://t.co/947jKey8LG

Road Policing continues. This is a light goods waste movement operation with our EA partners @EnvAgencySE. Scrap metal, hazardous material, roadworthiness and document checks along with appropriate waste licences. This is in Portsmouth today. #JOUCVU https://t.co/HwmxLuk1jZ

River Thames is over its banks here at #Henley overflowing locks at #Hambleden and #Shiplake, and rising at #Marlow and #Cookham where #TeamEA are preparing to set up defences.
#Flood defences going in at South Hinksey, Oxford.
🙏 📷@rlwmarsh https://t.co/NcTGL3WMKW
Inside one residents home @piersmorgan @BBCBreakfast @EnvAgency @GMB @Sotlive @publichealthe @PHE_uk @AaronBell4NUL @MattHancock @BorisJohnson https://t.co/CqSxz6WvVx

tweets.text: It's still very wet out there. At 13:15 1 Feb 2021 there are now 17 flood warnings and 57 flood alerts across the South East. Please stay safe at home if you can. Check your flood risk at https://t.co/64gyL62UXF #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/dIYytqdBTA

@floodmary When you see how many areas flooded yesterday from Lothian to Dorset, anything that encourages flood resistant is a good idea. An @EnvAgency worker was hurt as well as the cost to people and businesses of water flooding homes ⛈️🚨🏡

https://t.co/sfT4sgj9QO

Our children usually have different experiences or made up scenarios to write about. Unfortunately, this situation is real. Our children in Year 5 have been writing both in school and at home about the putrid smell coming from the landfill.  https://t.co/Zn9hOWkpHA
Homeowners who put in flood defences may pay less for insurance https://t.co/YBP6ZEQBnw

@UnderwaterMedia @Conwayk_ @CleanIlkley @rivercide_live @NicolaCutcher @NormaCKH @Alan_Lamb17 @AnglingTrust @newswife Appalling Mark. There is no excuse for sewage outflows into our rivers but untreated sewage discharged when it’s not raining surely breaches consent orders. Will the @EnvAgency step in? You know the answer. Of course not ....

Field teams have the pumps up and running at #SouthHinksey protecting residents.#TeamEA .⁦@EnvAgencySE⁩ ⁦@MarkHill03⁩ ⁦@Jennifer_Hil1⁩ ⁦@wifo_ea⁩ ⁦@sarahchareEA⁩ ⁦@johncurtinEA⁩ https://t.co/7Mju2arSMd

Accompanied by the usual BS statements from the @EnvAgency "We do allow storm overflows to discharge exceptionally into chalk streams".

Last time I checked, which was last week, TW had been dumping sewage into the River Chess for the 6th day in a row. Exceptional? https://t.co/N2khh8uHfr

tweets.text:
Sewage pollution? What sewage pollution? Oh, THAT sewage pollution. But not often. Well, yes, sometimes constantly.

https://t.co/gDDFYr7Vvd

So even when @JamesBevanEA is clarifying he continues to mislead. The EA did "permit" day-to-day untreated sewage discharges into the Chess in 2014 when it went on everyday from 2 Feb to 2nd June and in 2020 when it went on from 28 Feb to 17th April. Come clean @JamesBevanEA .

tweets.text:
...and THANKS for that support...

Agencies working together to protect homes and businesses...

In #Elmbridge or anywhere, you can check your flood-risk, get free alerts and read our tips for dealing with flooding: https://t.co/64gyL62UXF
#floodaware https://t.co/gOzQMb6f9C

Our field teams are super busy today. Here’s just some of the temporary flood barriers in #SouthHinksey and #Weybridge. Follow @MariaHerlihy to keep up to date with other work in this area #PrepareActSurvive. https://t.co/vSrlI2F0EF

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @Ofwat @OfwatChiefExec They can't continue to do with the level of damage being done, and/or they need stronger powers, and the Competition watchdog @CompetitionComm  should also be investigating as it's a classic case of abuse of monopoly. @GoodLawProject may be interested given the public harm?

PLEASE don’t take your daily exercise along the river bank today. We've had a number of reports of people walking and running through flood water. Please stay away from river edges. Its very dangerous as you can't see the bank and the river is flowing very fast #FloodAware https://t.co/fNDVCCLj4T
